fields.headline: Friday's rumours
fields.bodyText: Gabriel Batistuta is planning two years in the Premiership and Chelsea are favourites to land the 33-year-old Argentinean with Middlesbrough in hot pursuit, reveals Midas Soccer. Arsenal have stepped up the pressure on Feyenoord to drop the asking price for keeper Jerzy Dudek, by making moves moves to sign Dutch international Edwin Van der Sar from Juventus, reports the Sun. Kevin Keegan looks set to rescue David Ginola from his Aston Villa hell. The 34-year-old Frenchman has been linked with a move to Manchester City, says the Star. Martin Keown has urged Arsenal to buy Sol Campbell. The Sun reports that Campbell, who wants £130,000 a week, has only been on £14,000 a week at Spurs. Liverpool will only offer a maximum of £60,000 a week.
